intro: Basanacantha mollis, commonly known as the soft spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features soft, succulent leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, clustered flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its attractive foliage, it is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant.
